title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Living With Fire Video Series
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     Living With Fire Video Series                Living With Fire                         Fern Lake Fire  The Fern Lake Fire started on October 9, 2012 and was one of the largest fires park lands have seen in the last 100 years. This unprecedented winter fire, burned 3,500 acres of the park. Learn about the timeline of this event and see how crews were able to stop this human-caused wildland fire from exceeding park borders.   Duration:3 minutes, 45 seconds
